content:
{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-347-07-A
|Item_parent=Acute urine retention
|Item_parent_short=Acute urine retention
|Rank=A
|Title=Knowing the initial assessment of urinary retention
|Description=None
|Rubric=Additional tests
|Contributors=Jonathan Olivier
|Order=7}}

* No further tests are required as a matter of urgency.
* If there is any doubt about the diagnosis, a suprapubic ultrasound may be performed to assess bladder fullness.

properties.question: What is the initial assessment step for a patient with acute urine retention if the diagnosis is not immediately clear?
properties.option_a: Immediate catheterization to relieve urinary retention
properties.option_b: Perform a suprapubic ultrasound to assess bladder fullness
properties.option_c: Administer a bladder scan to evaluate urinary output
properties.option_d: Conduct a renal ultrasound to check for kidney stones
